JobIems.title: Ground Handling
JobIems.description: Ground handling is a vital part of the aviation industry that involves the services required to operate an aircraft while it's on the ground at an airport

JobIems.title: Airport Retails Shops
JobIems.description: As a retail team member, you'll play a key role in engaging customers by promoting, advising on, and selling a wide range of exclusive tax and duty-free products.

JobIems.title: Maintenance & Engineering
JobIems.description: A maintenance engineer is responsible for undertaking continuous routine maintenance on plants and machinery to ensure they run smoothly and reliably. They work with other professionals to improve efficiency and safety standards as well as organise repairs.

JobIems.title: Cabin Crew
JobIems.description: Cabin crew also known as Flight Attendants provide in-flight services to ensure that airline passengers have a comfortable and smooth flying experience. Their duties include answering passengers’ questions, enforcing safety measures before, during and after takeoff and serving food and beverages during flights.

JobIems.title: Assist Service
JobIems.description: A assist services or Customer Service Representative provides a company’s customers with the service they require. Their duties include receiving inbound calls, responding to complaints and selling a company’s products or services.

JobIems.title: Airport Security Officer
JobIems.description: The duties of an airport security employee may vary depending on their designation and specialisation. These professionals work in teams, with government officials and law enforcement agents to ensure the security and safety of passengers and personnel in an airport.

JobIems.title: Airlines Food Service Worker
JobIems.description: Airline food service workers typically work in the galley of an aircraft, where they provide passengers with meals, and perform food preparation, sanitation, and stocking duties. They may also serve special meals for passengers with dietary needs.
